name: Steve Bullock
tweet: It was an honor to be in Billings today to see Montana's health care workers be the first to receive the COVID-19 vaccine. This is a time to celebrate our health care workers for all they've done to care for our communities throughout this long, dark and challenging year.  https://t.co/fow2e7agJN

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: The most important package we’ve ever tracked. First COVID-19 vaccine shipment headed to Montana. Help for our health care workers is on the way.  https://t.co/a6zaEufljl

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We are also seeing some encouraging news with a decline in new positive cases and a decline in COVID-19 hospitalizations in Montana. The preventative health measures we have in place and the statewide mask requirement do make a difference.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We are preparing for the arrival of the first COVID-19 vaccines to Montana, with a focus on the first allotment for our health care workers. With many months until widespread distribution, it's up to all of us to take steps to slow the spread.   https://t.co/fxUnNbBg5b

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: This diverse group of Montanans represent impacted organizations across our state and are a critical part of ensuring collaboration and a successful distribution of the COVID-19 vaccine in Montana.    https://t.co/wzmoCemaGV

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: If Congress cannot agree on another pandemic stimulus package as the nation heads into winter with COVID-19 infections surging, we must do what we can to help Montanans today.  https://t.co/EpJAIjfQbD

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: The COVID-19 vaccine is a light at the end of the tunnel. However, that tunnel is long and Montana and other states are squarely in the middle of it. Lives are at stake in what we each do, individually, between now and the widespread availability of a vaccine.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: COVID-19 is projected to be near the top in leading causes of death in Montana this year.   It is within our power to save lives. If Montanans mask up, follow public health requirements, and stay home as much as possible, we can save hundreds of lives.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: More than 500 Montanans have lost their lives due to COVID-19. Communities across our state are deeply feeling the impact of this virus, now more than we’ve seen before, and families are facing a holiday season without the ones they love most.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: In October, 20,052 Montanans became infected with COVID-19. If you take a modest estimate and assume that each individual who tested positive had just 4 close contacts, in total over 100,200 Montanans would’ve had to quarantine or isolate for some part of the month of October.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Public health experts, doctors, and nurses have been joining me at press conferences for months to try to raise the alarm about rapidly rising COVID-19 cases. That alarm is undoubtedly ringing loud. It is going to be a long and challenging winter for our state and nation.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Montana is one big community of creatives, makers, and thinkers who have been leaders in addressing COVID-19 head on through innovative ideas. Check out the new Montana Innovation Hub designed to help businesses thrive into our state's future:  https://t.co/3MWogTlG2E

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Our healthcare workers are working tirelessly to care for Montanans hospitalized due to COVID-19. Nursing teams are now assisting 5 hospitals in Central and Eastern Montana to help with staffing shortages and ensure that together we can save lives.    https://t.co/bYlYfDw0n4

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Montana set a new daily record high in positive COVID-19 cases. This virus is real, it is spreading through our communities, and it can impact anyone. We must get our hands around this virus.   https://t.co/mCmcXSCJb2

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: This critical support will help to keep the doors of our rural hospitals open and ensure that patients in rural areas can receive care as COVID-19 continues to spread throughout Montana.   https://t.co/0hqNfw8tJ4

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Throughout the COVID-19 pandemic, we've been reminded of the many ways our citizen soldiers and airmen protect our citizens, and we are grateful for their commitment during these unprecedented and challenging times.  https://t.co/huH3DowRUV

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Among the many jobs of our healthcare workers during COVID-19 is having to "explain to yet another tearful family member that, no, you can't visit, but we'll hold the phone up for a FaceTime call."  https://t.co/NxDnKtgpk5

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We can slow the spread of this virus if we actually take it seriously. But we need every Montanan to take it seriously. Just one person with COVID-19 – in the wrong place at the wrong time – can spoil the whole bunch.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Local public health officers can’t keep Montanans safe from COVID-19 when businesses don’t follow public health rules and Montanans disregard basic preventative measures. Doctors and nurses can’t provide the best care possible if hospitals are overwhelmed.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Our frontline health workers are up against COVID-19, and they don’t need a bad flu season on top of it. Let’s do our part to keep our communities healthy by masking up and getting our flu shots.  https://t.co/4sA9wwWqsq

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Paulette opened the Mrs. Wright's Pastys shop after years of her family telling her she should sell her homemade recipe. With two rounds of Montana Business Stabilization grants, her dream can stay resilient through the COVID-19 challenge – and we can enjoy a delicious lunch.  https://t.co/SuJKGZ5jry

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Large gatherings continue to be one of our biggest threats to combating COVID-19. Large crowds increase the likelihood someone has the virus and will pass it on to others, and make it more difficult for local public health to contract trace.   https://t.co/kBYgpZttzk

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: "There are people walking around and thinking that COVID is not real. Let me tell you it’s real.” — Curtis Jorgensen  https://t.co/sQITFeez3s

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: On the last day of July, we had lost 60 Montanans to COVID-19. Today, barely into October, over 200 Montanans have been taken from their families, friends, and communities. That is over a 230% increase in deaths in just over two months.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: But it is also is our actions as Montanans that can flatten the curve, stop the onslaught of new infections, and ensure there’s enough hospital beds and ventilators for folks with severe cases or those needing care for non-COVID-19-related issues.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: "COVID-19 is surging in our community and in Montana. The situation is more serious than it has ever been in our state."   https://t.co/lBOJcMRsC5

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Our hospitals are strained as we head into flu season. We need all Montanans to take COVID-19 seriously, for our doctors and nurses who have spent the last 7 months working day and night to keep our communities safe.   https://t.co/N9J6kbwNdJ

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Lisa and I are thinking of the President and First Lady and we hope they have a quick and smooth recovery from COVID-19. It's clear this virus can impact anyone and it's important we all take precautions.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: A top White House doctor shares the concerns of Montanans over our increasing numbers of COVID-19 cases. Let's follow her lead and mask up, social distance, and avoid large gatherings.   https://t.co/kofvO0KRax

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: COVID-19 is still in our midst - more so than we've ever seen before since this virus first entered our state. If public health guidelines are followed, like masking up and social distancing, we can prevent the strain on our hospitals.   https://t.co/JhVT0y94vB

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: The increase in COVID-19 cases we are seeing in Montana is concerning, and now more than ever, we need every Montanan to do their part to protect our loved ones and communities.   #MaskUpMT, social distance, and follow guidelines from your local public health.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: When we act responsibly, Montanans can stay on the job. mom and pop shops in Montana often have two employees: mom and pop themselves. If they get COVID-19, they can't keep their business running.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: As our state's Chief Medical Officer Dr. Greg Holzman said, COVID-19 deaths have surpassed motor vehicle deaths in Montana this year. Wearing a mask is just like buckling up and driving the speed limit: a simple, commonsense measure to protect you and your neighbors.  https://t.co/i43Bo0twfc

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Montana currently ranks 6th in the nation on fastest COVID-19 job recovery. By following public health guidelines, we can keep Montana's business owners healthy and allow our economic recovery to continue.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: While Montanans are known for our independent spirit, we are capable of unified action towards a common goal – and it is through that community-mindedness that we can keep moving forward, save lives, and overcome COVID-19.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Over 150 deaths due to COVID-19 is a milestone we prayed we would not reach, and this virus continues to present difficult challenges in communities of our state.   https://t.co/FKA8sICMWM

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I wish this young Montanan a smooth and speedy recovery. We are learning more about COVID-19’s long-range impact each day, and it's in the best interest of all Montanans to continue to act with caution to prevent the spread.   https://t.co/a4UCmv9bme

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I'm thankful to Ember Singer, Lloyd Hogan III, local public health, and other community leaders who are spearheading Crow Nation's efforts to work as a community and mitigate the impact of COVID-19.   https://t.co/qLB3GMB6Oo

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: My statement on 100 deaths in Montana due to COVID-19. We must honor these Montanans by protecting the people and the state they loved.  https://t.co/y9qyWW2Vpt

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Masks are our best tool to fight COVID-19 while keeping our economy open. For the well-being of our small businesses and each other, shop local and #MaskUpMT.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: As we navigate a new normal with wildfire season in our midst, Montanans in every corner of our state are counting on one another to act responsibly to mitigate the risk of fires and of COVID-19.  https://t.co/3L0rWb6a8H

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: When you #MaskUpMT, you are acting in solidarity with your fellow Montanans. Together, we can slow the spread of COVID-19.  https://t.co/2FYmw12lAa

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I want to thank all those working hard to keep us all safe while we manage two concurrent challenges. Just as with COVID-19, prevention is key here. It’s imperative that Montanans take the necessary steps to make their homes and communities fire adapted.   https://t.co/e1I64Jeiif

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Montanans are as strong in spirit as we are in our resolve to stop COVID-19. Let’s keep fighting this virus together and #MaskUpMT.  https://t.co/eQZebTAYYu

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We are not defenseless against this virus in Montana. When we mask up, we protect our families and our communities from COVID-19.  https://t.co/MnPrNmTeyf

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Let’s work together to protect our communities from COVID-19.   https://t.co/4QXtnIvsxo

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Crews are working around the clock to fight for the safety of Montanans. I’m grateful to FEMA for their quick response, to Montana as we manage two competing crises with COVID-19, and to the firefighters working hard to maintain this fire.   https://t.co/NzTnOryyyv

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: “When Montanans venture out in winter, we know to bundle up with coat, hat, gloves and snow boots. When going out during the COVID-19 pandemic, we need the protection of a mask.”   https://t.co/VUr3okOnOb

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: The rate of COVID-19 infection in younger Montanans, especially those 20-39 years old who are more likely to attend social gatherings, is drastically increasing. This virus can impact anyone and no matter our age, it's up to all of us to do our part to slow the spread.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today I am thankful to Caty, who shared her COVID-19 story with her fellow Montanans. Before COVID, Caty was a 23 year old in robust health. Three weeks into recovery, she continues to experience challenging symptoms.   Her message: "Please don't take this lightly."  https://t.co/V5DFqw06Ci

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: By masking up, social distancing, and staying home when you are sick, you play a critical role in helping Montana control COVID-19.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: With over 50 deaths in the state due to COVID-19, these losses weigh heavily on our hearts. While our seniors remain the most vulnerable, immunocompromised and even otherwise healthy Montanans experience life-altering – and sometimes deadly – outcomes when they face this virus.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today I got to see where the science happens. Thank you to MSU for the tour of the lab, where we are gearing up to perform surveillance COVID-19 testing for our state. Your partnership is invaluable to Montana's fight against this virus.  https://t.co/bhdAe9aQ5r

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Large gatherings continue to spread COVID-19. As much as we all want to be with family and friends to celebrate life events, these decisions can have long reaching effects. Please protect your loved ones by taking the proper precautions, like social distancing and wearing a mask.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Using a business adaptability grant, @BillingsDepot made modifications to ensure the safety of their employees, customers and community, and keep business running during COVID-19. Thanks for the visit!   Businesses can apply for this grant and others at  https://t.co/PekA9NUNSy.  https://t.co/2iY34T500b

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: On behalf of all Montanans, I would like to express gratitude to President Cruzado and @montanastate for stepping up to the plate to increase testing capacity in Montana. We will continue our fight against COVID-19 together.  https://t.co/NjgHcaveBy

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We must make good hygiene, social distancing, and wearing masks habits as we continue to live with COVID-19. If we remain vigilant with our prevention efforts, we can stop the spread and save lives.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Mom and pop shops in Montana often have two employees: Mom and Pop themselves. If they get COVID-19, they can’t keep their business running. By wearing a mask, you protect our vibrant small business community. #MaskUpMT

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: It was a pleasure to visit with @FHNourish earlier this week and see how they've used COVID-19 relief funds and a @nokidhungry grant to provide fresh, nutritious produce and bolster food security for Montanans during these challenging times.  https://t.co/1KJXnH0NEi

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: This is about being a Montanan and being supportive of those around us.    We are going to team up, #MaskUpMT, and slow the spread of COVID-19.  https://t.co/7E69KmURKb

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Effective immediately, face coverings will be required n certain indoor spaces and for certain organized outdoor activities in counties currently experiencing four or more active cases of COVID-19 to slow the spread of the virus in Montana.  https://t.co/QEioCbfiU2

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: As more lives are lost in Billings from COVID-19 and we stand with the community and comfort the loved ones, we cannot become complacent.  Wearing a mask promotes kindness and respect towards others. That’s part of what it means to be a Montanan. Be a Montanan and #MaskUpMT

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: The situation unfolding at Canyon Creek Memory Care is a tragic reminder of the devastation COVID-19 can inflict on Montanans, particularly those most vulnerable. My thoughts are with the families of those we lost this weekend.  https://t.co/Q6Q5Vcd7ZC

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Small businesses make Montana vibrant, and we have grants available to help yours weather this unprecedented situation.   Apply at  https://t.co/PekA9NUNSy for grants to offset the cost of COVID-19 adaptations for your business.   https://t.co/iMP2umToQT

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Masks protect from fires, fumes, sawdust - and yes - COVID-19.   #MaskUpMT  https://t.co/3iawekYCRL

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I know Montanans are tired of four months of COVID-19, but we can’t let that fatigue allow us to let our guard down.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: The new daily highs in COVID-19 cases concern me deeply. Contact tracing, testing, adequate hospital capacity & supplies allow us to manage the virus at its current level – but if this trend continues, I will seriously consider reimplementing some public health restrictions.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today I held a press conference regarding our increasing COVID-19 cases, and Montana's business community joined in calling on Montanans to mask up to keep our state healthy and open. Watch the full press conference here:  https://t.co/hmbQq1NRh3

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today Montana topped over 1,000 cases of COVID-19 since the start of this virus. This is not a milestone to be celebrated, it’s one that showcases the virus hasn’t gone away.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: If we want to keep the Big Sky State open, we have to keep our guard up. Maintain social distancing where you can, wear a mask when you can't, and stay home and call your provider if you have any symptoms of COVID-19.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Wearing a mask where social distancing is difficult decreases the spread of COVID-19. If we don’t do things right in Montana, this virus can quickly get out of hand. Let’s continue to be an example for the rest of the nation, as we did in our initial response to this virus.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Living in our new normal means adapting how we work and play to ensure the safety of our colleagues, our families, and ourselves. I ask folks to exercise caution in the workplace and elsewhere and avoid actions that have led to COVID-19 clusters.  https://t.co/MRKZxpSWjn

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Our fight against COVID-19 isn't over. Let's work together and keep the 406 - and our family, friends, and neighbors - healthy.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Montanans appreciate our public lands, especially in the time of COVID-19. There's still time left to register for the @PPLTHelena's Don't Fence Me In Trail Run to support our trails - this year, virtually and socially distanced.  https://t.co/niDJC29bN9

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Each loss of a Montanan to COVID-19 weighs heavily on our communities. While we send our condolences to the loved ones impacted, we must all continue to remember we are in this together and it’s up to us to keep our friends and neighbors safe.  https://t.co/MUVkMNyBTD

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: .@GuardMontana is always here for us. From helping fight COVID-19 to responding to natural disasters here or abroad, our citizen soldiers are eager to serve. If you share their desire to help our community, consider joining the Montana National Guard today.  https://t.co/EYXTZqD1rN

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: All 8 of Montana’s Tribal Nations have completed first rounds of community testing events. Thank you to the Confederated Salish and Kootenai Tribes for making testing available this week - and I’m grateful to all of our tribes and partners for their work fighting COVID-19.  https://t.co/YQ81Npx2NK

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I’m saddened to learn of another death in Big Horn County due to COVID-19 and mourn with the community as they face another loss. I urge all Montanans to continue taking the precautions they’ve taken all along the way to protect one another from this virus.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today I’m hosting the 2020 Wildfire Season Briefing. While this year’s briefing looks a lot different via Zoom than in-person, we will continue to work to protect lives and communities across Montana, and our mission now includes protecting firefighters against COVID-19.  https://t.co/xtUESFBibt

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We are seeing an increase in the number of COVID-19 cases, as expected through enhanced testing, contact tracing efforts, and further reopening. We must learn to live in a new normal and that includes remaining cautious and  wearing a mask where social distancing isn't possible.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: With another tragic loss of life to COVID-19, we are again reminded that we are all neighbors and we have the responsibility to look out for one another. The virus is still here with us and we must act with the safety of our parents and grandparents in mind.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: As we continue with reopening, I ask that Montanans and any travelers into our state honor the restrictions in our tribal communities. They have our full support as they determine what is best to keep their communities safe and healthy from COVID-19.  https://t.co/uyTi5fiUyq

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Masks help stop the spread of COVID-19. I ask that Montanans join me in masking up when it is hard to maintain social distancing.  https://t.co/yoZBAxqARd

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We have lost another Montanan to COVID-19. All of Montana stands with the family and friends of this person as they grieve. I ask that Montanans remain cautious and continue to act with the health and safety of their neighbors in mind.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today I announced the Montana Meat Processing Infrastructure Grant program, available immediately to help small and medium-sized meat processors respond to COVID-19 supply distributions and boost processing and storage capacity.   https://t.co/QcPUEYUVig

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I visited the Fort Peck Assiniboine and Sioux Tribes community testing event today. Thank you for partnering with the state to combat COVID-19 in your community and all of Montana. It is efforts like these that help to keep the virus contained.  https://t.co/tJRyUoMoAT

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Partnering with Tribal Nations is crucial as we ramp up testing across the state. Thank you to the Chippewa Cree Tribe for having me at Rocky Boy’s Indian Reservation to check out their drive thru testing, which will help to stop the spread of COVID-19.  https://t.co/vwxKLoiW5N

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: The Montana Business Adaptation Grant program will provide reimbursement for COVID-19 expenses related to keeping staff and businesses safe. Businesses can apply starting on Monday for up to $5,000 at  https://t.co/PekA9NUNSy.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: The precautions Montanans are taking mean our state has one of the lowest rates of COVID-19 in the nation, and we must remain fully committed to social distancing. We have to keep at it, for the sake of the people and the state we love.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: By acting early, we flattened the curve of COVID-19 in Montana and saved lives. Montanans must continue to do our part and be vigilant with social distancing so the curve stays flat and Montana stays open.  https://t.co/9P1rqGGvee

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today Montana mourns another loss due to COVID-19. I ask that Montanans continue to commit ourselves to fighting the spread of this virus and take seriously our responsibility to protect our loved ones and neighbors from this disease.  https://t.co/8XFxfBqyRY

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I’ve order flags lowered to half-staff through Sunday as we honor our neighbors nationwide who lost their lives to COVID-19. Our hearts go out especially to the 16 Montanans we have lost and to their families and friends.  https://t.co/eklGR8gM5z

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: All along the way, we will continue to ensure health care workers have the supplies they need to treat COVID-19 and non-COVID-19 patients. We will ramp up even further our ability to contact and trace, which has been effective in mitigating the spread of the virus.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: The 500,000 N95 masks we secured today will ensure our health care workers, who are the backbone of the fight against COVID-19, have what they need to safely do their jobs.  https://t.co/tpgM0YzGhN

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We will handle Montana's budget just like we’ve handled our response to COVID-19: based on science and data and by responsibly handling the day-to-day changes. We won’t handle it based on politics.  https://t.co/LhzMip6s02

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today is #NationalNursesDay. Their knowledge, compassion, and bravery make nurses the backbone of Montana’s fight against COVID-19. I know I speak for Montanans when I say that we are grateful to nurses for their tireless dedication to their fellow citizens.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Montanans have been hit hard by COVID-19, but Montanans also look out for each other. So today we announced $123 million in grants to provide economic relief.   Individuals and businesses can start applying for grants on May 7th. Learn more here:    https://t.co/o7SiewrM7L

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: As we are living through challenging times with COVID-19, we must not forget the other important issues we face today. Today I call on Montanans to stand with the tireless families and advocates who fight to end the epidemic of Missing and Murdered Indigenous Women and Girls.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I continue to be humbled by the thoughtfulness, generosity and compassion of Montanans in response to COVID-19.   Free and confidential help is available during this time. Visit this link for more👇🏼  https://t.co/U9Ue0Nd7QB

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: If any Montanan has any COVID-19 symptom - including chills, repeated shaking with chills, muscle pain, headache, sore throat, new loss of taste or smell, fever, cough, and shortness of breath - I’m asking you to get tested and I’m asking providers to do the test.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We continue to ask providers to test any Montana with one or more symptoms of COVID-19, including the CDC's recent expanded list of symptoms.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I am establishing a testing target of 60,000 tests/month. This is a long-term goal that we will be working towards in our continued response to COVID-19.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I have secured hundreds of thousands of face masks, shields and gloves from private market distributors to protect Montana health care workers on the front lines of the response to COVID-19. This is something I will continue to fight for every single day.  https://t.co/MmQjkjxicz

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today we learned of two more deaths in Montana due to COVID-19. Each one is a reminder of the danger of the virus to our most vulnerable and as a community, we meet these losses with heavy hearts. We must continue to take care of each other through our actions to slow the spread.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: While there are reasons for optimism, today is another sober reminder that this virus can impact any community. Today we learned of two more losses of life due to COVID-19 in two Montana counties where it is their first death. My family, like all Montana families, are with you.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: My heart aches for the community, which has been particularly impacted, and the family members of this Montanan. As we see how COVID-19 can inundate our smaller communities, I urge all Montanans to continue doing their part to protect our most vulnerable.  https://t.co/s2Tnmzj7OW

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: When Montana calls for help, our National Guard answers. From fires to COVID-19, our citizen soldiers are there for their neighbors and communities. Thank you for protecting Montanans during this time.  https://t.co/tXggRVfgAc

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Elaine, Donna and their colleagues at Montana’s State Public Health Lab are crucial to our state’s fight against COVID-19. They have worked tirelessly to perform tests to diagnose Montanans and protect our communities. Their work helps Montana to slow the spread. Thank you.  https://t.co/loV9Lv0KF5

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: For Montana families that can’t make their housing payment right now because they’ve lost income due to COVID-19, this will help prevent a months-long rent backlog from coming due all at once.  https://t.co/F32kCD2dmW

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: As governor, I’ve always enjoyed visiting Montanans in their communities. While that’s not possible at this time, it’s especially important that I can hear from Montanans directly and answer their health and economic concerns related to COVID-19. Join us today!  https://t.co/5BNA4sJ3Jf

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I am saddened to hear of another death due to COVID-19 in Montana and am thinking of the family and friends who are grieving the loss of this fellow Montanan. We must take all precautions to protect our family, friends, and Montana’s most vulnerable during this difficult time.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Yesterday I visited Shelby, Montana for briefings of the on-the-ground situation as COVID-19 impacts the rural community. Thank you to all of the healthcare heroes and experts working hard to prevent further spread of the virus. Keep on keeping on Shelby.  https://t.co/UZo2GOR1oe

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Local and county governments are integral to the response to COVID-19. This directive ensures Montana taxpayers won’t be forced to pay a penalty to access federal aid to respond to the unprecedented economic situation caused by COVID-19.  https://t.co/dVxt4AsVyD

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Montanans across the state have been relying on first responders and we’re incredibly grateful for everything they’ve done to fight COVID-19. This measure ensures first responders can safely do their jobs during this emergency.  https://t.co/25CO0jdaFW

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: As we all work together to slow the spread of COVID-19, I’m daily reminded we are in this together. And we will get through it together. Thank you to all Montanans for your diligence and sacrifice during this time.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today we solemnly learned of another death in Montana from COVID-19. My heart goes out to the loved ones of this fellow Montanan. Each loss of life impacts another community and another family – and indeed, all of us through our shared bond as Montanans.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I'm calling for an extension to the Census deadline to accommodate COVID-19 health and safety measures. In Montana, we must ensure that everyone is counted. Our schools, hospitals, highways, communities and families depend on it.  https://t.co/rSfj8DyvrE

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today is #CensusDay2020 and @LtGovMikeCooney and I are asking all Montanans to fill our their 2020 Census form. In fact, you can do so while staying at home to slow the spread of COVID-19.  https://t.co/NbaVan4Ate

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We lost two more Montanans, a total of four, to COVID-19. This is a blow to our statewide community and a heartbreaking reminder to us all that we must continue to do everything we can to slow the spread of this disease.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I’m saddened that a 2nd Montanan has died from COVID-19. No matter in which community we live, the impact of each loss of life has a ripple effect throughout the state and serves as a reminder of how serious this disease is. Our hearts go out to the loved ones of this Montanan.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Thank you to: The grocery store employees who work tirelessly  The truck drivers who keep shelves stocked  The emergency responders on duty The teachers who are providing high quality education in creative ways  We’re cheering for all those on the frontlines of COVID-19.  https://t.co/xAk4BcIKeT

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: During the Stay at Home order, Montanans are still able and encouraged to responsibly enjoy our public lands. Follow social distancing requirements, avoid crowded trailheads, and recreate near the communities you live. It’s up to all of us to slow the spread of COVID-19.  https://t.co/Kt9sJbq5oQ

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Thank you to Montana’s health workers – doctors, nurses, CNAs, pharmacists and pharmacy techs, custodians, receptionists, and more – who fight COVID-19, while ensuring Montanans can access other essential medical care to stay healthy. Your work is the backbone of this battle.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I’m heartbroken to learn of Montana’s first death due to COVID-19. Montana truly is one big small town – this news hits us hard, but we’re in this together. My family and I send our love and support to the family, friends, and community of our fellow Montanan.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: There’s no doubt that COVID-19 is causing a lot of hardship for Montana families. It’s also causing incredible hardships for our front line doctors, nurses and other hospital staff across the country.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Locally elected officials best understand the voting needs of their communities. We can protect both the public’s health at a time we face unprecedented challenges with COVID-19 and the right to vote with this direction.  https://t.co/fshAphPiJ6

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: These hardworking ER doctors are right – time is a valuable resource to fight COVID-19. Staying home slows the spread of this virus and buys us time. Thank you to all the Montanans doing their part.  https://t.co/Yy6jr05y5K

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: We must take COVID-19 seriously, and we must prepare for the curve to go up. But with a continued focus on working together as Montanans, our state can get out in front of this.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today I announced the extension of closures of public schools and dine-in food service, alcoholic beverage businesses and other entities through April 10 and mandated social distancing measures to slow the spread of COVID-19 in Montana.  https://t.co/P90qL9d7Ff

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Social distancing is paramount to slowing the spread of COVID-19, but we also must prepare for a potential surge in critically ill patients. Today’s actions ensure we can focus on providing urgently needed quality care without delay.   https://t.co/FQ7gUaEq9u

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Access to health care is more important than ever as we face the COVID-19 pandemic.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Governors are on the front lines of the fight against COVID-19. The Senate must give us the resources we need to help our states.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Montanans across the state have been impacted by COVID-19 and extending the deadline gives taxpayers breathing room without having to worry about interest or penalties.  https://t.co/i9Du7WK0Bk

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today I issued a travel advisory recommending all Montanans who return from international travel to self-quarantine for 14 days. By staying home after traveling, Montanans can play a key role in preventing COVID-19 spread in their community.  https://t.co/U4eDqnUmP7

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Help them help you — stay home to  flatten the curve so our healthcare facilities aren’t overwhelmed and our health workers minimize their exposure to COVID-19.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: I’d like to thank providers across the state who are on the front lines, balancing routine care with the new volume created by COVID-19. We truly couldn’t do this without you, and I admire your fearless dedication to Montanans.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Expanding telemedicine will provide the physical, mental, and substance use care Montanans need without overwhelming health care facilities responding to COVID-19 or risking unnecessary exposure.  https://t.co/cDjohNPitW

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: These rules will ensure that workers impacted by COVID-19, whether it’s because they’ve been laid off, are quarantined, or need to take care of a family member, can do so without worrying about how they will make ends meet during these difficult times.  https://t.co/EeTJJCUxOW

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Yesterday I announced several measures to slow the spread of COVID-19 in Montana, including closing public K-12 schools and recommending limiting all gatherings. It’s going to take all of us working together to overcome these challenging and dynamic times.  https://t.co/D3sGAEzgD3

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today I announced measures to slow the spread of COVID-19 and protect vulnerable Montanans, including closing public K-12 schools for two weeks, strongly recommending social distancing measures, and limiting visitation at nursing home facilities.  https://t.co/9VnUKCzOZt

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Today I hosted a call with Montana press to provide an update on Montana's four positive COVID-19 cases and share additional response efforts. I’m pleased to report that all four patients are at home and recovering.

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Four people in Montana have tested positive for COVID-19. We've been monitoring this rapidly evolving situation and vigorously preparing for this virus to reach Montana, making today's news unsurprising.  https://t.co/uW8wE1R46X

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Declaring a state of emergency means I can mobilize all available state resources to mitigate the impact of COVID-19 on Montanans. That's why I'm doing so now, before we have a confirmed case in our state.  https://t.co/2XEUCKM6kJ

name: Steve Bullock
tweet: Earlier today it was announced a Montanan visiting Maryland tested presumptive positive for COVID-19. We can now confirm the patient did not have coronavirus while she was in Montana and has not been in the state since November of last year.
